sentence: Aug 19 (Reuters) - Lowe's Cos Inc LOW.N beat analysts' estimates for quarterly same-store sales on Wednesday, as it benefited from a surge in demand for home improvement products from consumers stuck indoors due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Same-store sales rose 34.2%, beating analysts' estimates of a 13.2% increase, according to IBES data from Refinitiv.
That was higher than larger rival Home Depot Inc's HD.N 23.4% rise.
The company's net earnings rose to $2.83 billion, or $3.74 per share, for the second quarter from $1.68 billion, or $2.14 per share, a year earlier.
